^ u additional Month's leave of absence has been obtuaed from the Academit Roy ale, at Pari*, for

HAREM!

An additional Mouth's leave of absence has been obtained from the Academic Royale, at Paris, for

Mademoiselle PAULINE LEROUX,
Mademoiselle CAVA,

in poiiseqiienre of which, this popular Ballet will be plnved in future as an Afterpiece.

GUSTAVUS T H E T H I R D :

Was last Evening performed for the 76th Night, and while
Public Opinion has pronounced it to be one of the most
Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage that
Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
takenforsuch a continued Period. Its performance however can not be resumed before Monday next, in consequence
of the necessity for
RENOVATING T H E SCENERY, DRESSES & DECORATIONS,

For the 2nd Time in the course ofthe Season

in order that the numerous Families now coming to Town
uiay have an opportunity of seeing it in its original sjriendour.

OF T H E HAREM!

Month's leave of absence lias been obtained from the Academic Royale, at Paris, for

Mademoisella PAULINE LEROUX,
mademoiselle CAVA,

mademoiselle VAGOH,

GUSTAVUS T H E T H I R D :

Was performed on Monday, for the 76th Night, and while
Public Opinion has pronounced it to be one of the most
Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage that
Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Period. Its performance however can not be resumed before Monday next, in consequence
of the necessity for
RENOVATING T H ESCENERY, DRESSES & DECORATIONS,

For the 2nd Time in the course of the Season

in order that the numerous Families now coming to Town
may have an opportunity of seeing it in its original splendour.

GUSTAVUS T H E T H I R D :

Was performed on Monday, for the 76th Night, and while
Public Opinion has pronounced it to be one of the most
Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage that
Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Period. Its performance however can not be resumed before Monday next, in consequence
of the necessity for
RENOVATING T H E SCENERY, DRESSES & DECORATIONS,

For the 2nd Time in the course ofthe Season

in order that the numerous Families now coming to Town
may have an opportunity ofseeing it in its original splendour.

On the Principle of those given during the recent CARNIVAL, at the Academic Royalc tie

"uch Amusements would interfere with the usual Performances of the Drama, it has been
deemed advisable to introduce the principal Features of them in

Will m a k e their F i r s t A p p e a r a n c e in this Country, since their r e t u r n from America.
T o - m o r r o w , in t h e O p e r a of ' C I N D E R E L L A . '
£T It having been suggested to the Lessee of the National Theatres, that some reduction in the
Price of Adit.issiou to the Boxes would be acceptable to the Public, he has adopted it in the Circles above
the Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to s'ate, that the eoattaaa.ee of this redue««
Scale of Admission will depend entirely ou an nicrease of Patronage from the Public.
The Prices of Admission therefore will be, Dress Cirele, First Price 7s.—Second Price 3s. 6d.—
Upper Circles, First Price 5s. Second Price 3s.—Pit, First Price 3s. 6d. Second Price 2s.—Lower Gallery
£*. Second Price Is.—Upper Gallery Is Sacoud Price 6d.
The Stalls will also be reduced to 7s.
The Entrance to the Dress Circle will be from the right of the Rotunda in Brydges Street.
The Entrance to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotunda, in Brydges Street.
_
The Doors will be opened at Half-past Six, and the Performances commence at Seven.
